alert.note: Alert for Effingham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 12:12PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, LIBERTY, EFFINGHAM AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 1212 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Ellabell, or 8 miles northwest of Richmond Hill, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Pooler, Lanier, Bloomingdale and Ellabell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify. Be certain to monitor local radio and TV stations as well as local cable TV outlets for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Effingham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty
